snippet: The contractors who provide armies of field workers in the state say they are already preparing for the potential cost the new health law will add to their businesses.
abstract: Farm labor contractors across California who provide armies of field workers say they are already preparing for potential cost that Affordable Care Act will add to their businesses; provision in law will require hundreds of thousands of field workers to be covered by health insurance.

byline.contributor: This article was produced in collaboration with Kaiser Health News, an editorially independent program of the Kaiser Family Foundation.

lead_paragraph: The contractors who provide armies of field workers in the state say they are already preparing for the potential cost the new health law will add to their businesses.

headline.main: Tacking Health Care Costs Onto California Farm Produce
headline.print_headline: Tacking Health Care Costs Onto California Farm Produce

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
